jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? CEO/Chief Librarian Flesherton , ON Description Situated in one of the most beautiful parts of Grey County, the Grey Highlands Public Library is a 3 branch system, with locations in Flesherton (Main Branch), Markdale, and Kimberley. It is the place to inspire, explore, discover, and create. Serving a population of approximately 10,400 people (2021 Census), and the contracting municipalities of Chatsworth and West Grey, the Library's mission is to engage and empower through innovative programs, services, and information.
PURPOSE OF POSITIONReporting to the Grey Highlands Public Library Board under the authority of the Ontario’s Public Libraries Act, the Chief Executive Officer/Chief Librarian is a full-time permanent position (37.5 hrs/week) accountable for leading the organization, in accordance with Board policies and related legislation, and for anticipating trends and change. The CEO advises the Board and makes recommendations concerning new policies and services; serves as secretary/treasurer to the Board; serves as one of the Board’s representatives to the public, to professional organizations, and to government agencies; directs resources toward the fulfillment of the organization’s mission, vision, and strategic priorities, and bears responsibility for preparing budgets and managing resources. The CEO operates the Library under a community-led philosophy, which puts the needs of the community and Library users first and responds to those needs in a positive, helpful, friendly, and efficient manner.MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES Leadership and Strategy (35%) Leads the Grey Highlands Public Library’s 4 branch system, ensuring modern and meaningful library and information services are being provided to the public. Acts as professional advisor and secretary/treasurer to the Board. Understands and evaluates professional trends and ensures the Library maintains relevance to users. Evaluates and reports on the Library’s service, financial, and administrative Reports to the Board regularly and ensures the Board is aware of the ongoing requirements of the Library System (staff, finances, patrons). Advises the Board of areas of need for policy development and strategic planning. In collaboration with the Board, develop a strategic plan for the system. Ensures that employees of the Library execute the strategic plan, with a focus on alignment between the mission, values, strategic priorities, goals, objectives, resource allocation, and annual budget. Liaise with the Municipality, at the invitation of the CAO and approval of the Library Board, and occasionally represent the Library at Municipal Senior Management Team meetings providing input on Library planning and strategic initiatives; and communicate each organization’s missions and values to the other. Implements and communicates Board decisions to all Library employees. Leads by example and models problem-solving skills, responsibility/accountability through personal example, and excellence. Develops and sustains an organizational culture that embodies open and two-way communication, customer focus, learning and innovation, accountability, teamwork, respect, and trust. Serves as the staff advisor to all Board Committees or delegates as appropriate. In collaboration with the Board chairman, prepare board meeting agendas; ensure timely preparation of minutes, reports, and statistics; communicate with the Board regarding issues related to the library. Advise and inform the Library Board of current and new legislation (i.e., Public Library Act, AODA, and OHSA) as it relates to the library and stay apprised of the community’s current and changing needs. Fiscal Management and Governance (30%) Provides the Board with financial statements and reports on revenues and expenditures as prepared and provided by municipal staff. Monitors the financial management of the Library; receives and accounts for all the Board’s money. Prepares the annual budget in conjunction with the Board based on present and anticipated needs. Responsible for expending the budget, authorizing the payment of accounts, and reporting on the state of the budget to the Board; collaborates with the Municipal Treasurer in preparation for the annual audit. Receive charitable donations on behalf of the Library, issue receipts for income tax purposes, maintain donor and financial records, and prepare and submit the annual report to the Agency. Administer Charitable Status in compliance with the Canada Revenue Agency. requirements. Research, pursue, and secure alternate funding sources as directed by the Board. Manage grant projects. Responsible for all property and equipment owned, leased, or rented by the Library System and ensures the accuracy of all procedural manuals. Responsible for the preparation of tenders and the negotiations of contracts for goods, services, and capital projects. Ensures that the Board is protected and is advised of any liabilities. Serve as one of three signing officers for the Board. Ensures appropriate governmental ministries are aware of the ongoing needs and programs of the Library System and ensures compliance with legislative mandate. Establishes and maintains communication and cooperative working relationships with other municipal departments (CAO, Treasurer, etc.) and other government departments. Identifies and maintains effective relationships with appropriate stakeholders such as other libraries, universities, research organizations, governments, agencies, businesses, media, non-governmental organizations, community leaders, and related institutions. Represents the Library at provincial, national, and international conferences. Provide corporate oversight to goals and directions and ensure the asset management program aligns with the Municipality’s strategic plan in cooperation with the senior management team. Human Resources (20%) Responsible for the hiring/termination, supervision, discipline, training, and development of library employees and the enforcement of policies established by the Library Board. Develop onboarding and offboarding procedures. Provides leadership and is responsible for the general operation of the Library and the performance of the staff. Ensures the smooth, day-to-day operations of the Library through supervision of and delegation to all staff, and through the provision of library and public relations services. Ensures that staff resources are appropriately deployed as per the knowledge, training, and experience of staff and within budget constraints. Promote team and organizational effectiveness and proactively address morale, cooperation, and productivity issues. Manage volunteers with a focus on promoting engagement, and observance of procedures and protocols. Responsible, as a Supervisor, for health and safety under the Occupational Health & Safety Act (OHSA). This includes, but is not limited to: Ensuring employees are properly trained in health and safety responsibilities, and use of equipment, and are aware of potential dangers on the job and how to deal with them. Ensuring safe and proper equipment, standard operating procedures, supervision, and communication (including written instruction), and current MSDS sheets, where applicable. Cooperating with the JHSC to provide a safe and healthy work environment and take every precaution reasonable in the circumstances. Ensuring employees are working safely within the law and safe work practices and procedures (wearing personal protective equipment (PPE), ensuring all guards are in place, understanding and following standards operating procedures), and evaluating performance. Developing and maintaining an understanding of the OHSA, health and safety policies, and identifying and reporting concerns to Department. Investigating and reporting accidents and injuries. Facility Management (10%) Manages the environment in all branches to enhance user experience. Coordinates with contractors, vendors, and the Municipality to ensure the ongoing operation and maintenance of all Library facilities and related capital equipment. Creates and maintains a healthy and safe environment for Library users, staff, and volunteers. Oversees Library building and renovation projects.
Public Service and Collections (5%) Assist with collection development and circulation when needed. Provide special events support to the programming staff. Establish procedures and resources to support the acquisition of Library materials. Approve collection purchases when necessary. Enforce the Library’s policies and procedures in the supervision of public service. Apply effective techniques in addressing customer concerns or complaints.
KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS Education and Experience: Master of Library and Information Science from an accredited University, or, at the discretion of the Board, an equivalent combination of education and experience. A minimum of three (3) years experience in a supervisory/managerial role related to library management, including at least (2) years as a Branch Librarian, or as determined at the discretion of the Board. Proven track record in the areas of organizational leadership, strategic planning, service excellence, public relations, marketing, and partnership development. Certification in Mental Health First Aid or willingness to obtain is an asset. Certification of CPR/AED Level C certification or willingness to obtain is an asset. A valid G class license and vulnerable sector check. Work Requires: Demonstrated experience designing and delivering customer-focused programs and services. Knowledge of EDI principles and practices and a commitment to diversity and inclusion in public libraries. Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to deal with elected officials, government departments, staff, and the general public. Proven knowledge and theoretical understanding of relevant technologies. Comprehensive working knowledge of applicable legislation/Acts/ Regulations; the philosophy of public library services, standards, resources, and technology; of professional practice in cataloguing and classification, collection development, and organization; and of classic and current events, books, authors, and publishing. Ability to evaluate the changing needs of the community and to strive to develop Library services to meet those needs. Ability to work independently and effectively as the facilitator of and member of a team. Ability to work under pressure, complete multiple assignments, and function effectively in a high-volume workplace with tight deadlines. Advanced analytical, problem-solving and research skills; accuracy and attention to detail. Flexibility regarding workload and schedule as frequent interruptions are expected from issues arising from management and employees, and attendance outside of office hours may be required. Strong oral and written communication, and presentation skills, complemented by proficiency in computer literacy and Office 365. WORKING CONDITIONSWork is conducted in a standard public library environment with stress and pressures associated with executive-level position. Must be adaptable to performing under stress and when confronted with emergency situations. The mental effort required is considerable and constant with frequent interruptions and deadlines. Responsible for the financial management of the organization where errors could result in loss of funding. As a community liaison, the release of inaccurate information could negatively impact the Library’s relationship with the community. Occasional exposure to disgruntled members of the public and may work alone at times. Work involves traveling to other Municipal buildings or off-site and out-of-town meetings and training.Physical requirements:Work is typically performed in an indoor environment with the regular requirement to lift boxes of books, moderately heavy to heavy (20-40 lb.). During winter months, shoveling and clearing snow off walkways and Library exits. Stooping, crouching, and reaching to low and high shelves. Pushing wheeled carts loaded up to 100lbs and climbing a short ladder.Sitting and working at repetitive tasks, keyboard work. View computer screen for prolonged periods of time up to 3 hours.
Hours of work may vary, and regular overtime is required. Generally, on call. Attendance at after-hours meetings and special events may be required from time to time.
CONTACTSCommunication with internal and external individuals is regular in this position. Internally, this includes municipal employees, Board Directors, Board/Committee members, members of Council, and other municipal employees. Externally, this includes the public, consultants, contractors, members of the media, and government representatives. COMPENSATION
Salary range of $88,413-$103,409 (under review) per annum plus comprehensive benefits package.
To Apply:
Please submit a cover letter and resume to jobs@greyhighlandspubliclibrary.com with the subject heading "CEO/Chief Librarian" describing your experience, qualifications, and future goals with the Library system no later than 5pm on Friday, October 13, 2023.To learn more, visit www.greyhighlandspubliclibrary.com. Personal information submitted will be managed in accordance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act and will be used only to determine eligibility for employment. Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada. Preferred candidates will be required to submit a Criminal Record Check.
We thank all who apply but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. First-round interviews are scheduled to take place the week of October 16. Compensation $88,413-$103,409 Closes: 13 October, 2023 Grey Highlands Public Library Flesherton , ON Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Librarian, Adult Services Milton , ON Description Milton Public Library (MPL) is committed to inspiring through discovery, collaboration and creation. As part of one of the fastest-growing municipalities in North America, Milton Public Library is an award winning system focused on innovation. MPL empowers the community to: Read. Learn. Create. Connect. Position: Adult Services Librarian Status: Full-Time Home Location: Sherwood Library Salary Range: $68,433.38 - $82,480.25 Position Summary The Adult Services Librarian is responsible for the development, delivery and coordination of community outreach, engagement activities and programs with a focus on Adults. The Adult Services Librarian has a strong emphasis on building and maintaining community partnerships with a wide range of groups within their portfolio. The Adult Services Librarian participates in ensuring a balanced, current and relevant collection of library materials, as assigned, and delivers public service such as reference and readers advisory. The Adult Services Librarian also acts in an “In-Charge” capacity. Typical Duties and Responsibilities Responsible for the oversight, coordination and delivery of programs and services with a focus on Adults. Identifies and coordinate community outreach and engagement opportunities with a focus on Adults. Actively seeks and develops community partnerships. Works collaboratively with different, agencies, departments, locations and teams to ensure quality Adult based programs that meet our customer’s needs. Demonstrates customer service excellence in the delivery of in-depth reference and readers’ advisory services and the effective merchandising of collections, including development of new merchandising initiatives. Participates in the collection development for an assigned area of Milton Public Libraries collection. This includes, selection and evaluation to ensure MPL’s collections meet the needs of its increasingly diverse community. Supports MPL’s virtual presence, identifying marketing outreach and other opportunities. Participates in committee work and contributes to the planning of Public Service. Contributes to the development of service goals and policy development Provides input into the Collection Management Policy Acts in an “In-Charge” capacity as required Attends relevant meetings, workshops, courses and conferences as required Performs other duties as assigned Qualifications/Competencies Master
of Library Science (MLIS) and one year relevant librarian experience Experience
in community outreach and engagementExperience
with library materials selectionDemonstrated
experience in program developmentKnowledgeable
with new and emerging technologiesExperience
in an automated environment and with computer skillsStrong
customer service backgroundExcellent
oral and written communications skillsValid
G class drivers license and access to a reliable vehicle Ability
to work independently and in team environment Application Process Interested candidates are asked to submit a resume and covering letter indicating how they meet the qualifications of this position by Friday, October 6, 2023 by 5:00 pm quoting posting 23-22 to: Human Resources Email: careers@beinspired.ca ONLY THOSE SELECTED FOR AN INTERVIEW WILL BE CONTACTED. The Milton Public Library thanks all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, RSO 1990, for recruitment purposes. Questions about this collection of personal information should be directed to: Chief Librarian, Milton Public Library, 1010 Main Street East, Milton, ON, L9T 6H7 The Milton Public Library is pleased to accommodate individual needs in accordance with the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), within our recruitment process. If you require accommodation at any time throughout the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at careers@beinspired.ca Compensation $68,433.38 - $82,480.25 Closes: 6 October, 2023 Milton Public Library Milton , ON Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Supervisor, Technical Services North Vancouver , BC Description Come join our team at Capilano University Library! We are seeking a library
technician to join us as Supervisor, Technical Services at our North Vancouver
Campus.About the PositionThe Supervisor, Technical Services oversees day-to-day operations and
provides leadership and coordination of duties for staff in the Technical
Services Department (five full-time staff). In this role, you will prioritize
and assign work, schedule departmental workflows (including coordinating time
off requests and work schedules), and oversee the area’s quality assurance. You will train and coach
Technical Services staff, participate in selection committees, and support the
University Librarian in goal setting and performance management for your direct
reports. Both strong supervisory and technical capacity are required for this role.
We are seeking a candidate with supervisory or other applicable leadership
experience, strong financial and numerical
literacy (for oversight of library acquisitions), and skills in applying cataloguing standards.
Knowledge of technical services workflows and ILS applications, particularly those which relate to acquisitions and
cataloguing processes, are central to this role. Experience within a formal technical services
department is not necessary if other experience can be shown as commensurate.
If you are excited about the opportunity to lead our Technical Services team,
we want to hear from you. Please review the Job Specification for a
full description of the required
skills, education, and experience. If you do
not meet all of the requirements exactly, but have commensurate experience or
education, please explain in your cover letter. We welcome interested
applicants from diverse experience and educational backgrounds.About Us Learn about the Capilano University Library’s vision and service standards: https://library.capilanou.ca/about-the-library/library-vision-and-service-standards/
Capilano University and the Library are
committed to fostering an inclusive environment, and strive to build a culture
that instills equity, diversity, and inclusion. Capilano University has
signed the Okanagan
Charter:: An International Charter for Health Promoting Universities and
Colleges (2015) and is committed to its calls to action, including https://www.capilanou.ca/about-capu/get-to-know-us/our-values/our-edi-commitment/
For more information on the University’s vision visit https://www.capilanou.ca/about-capu/governance/presidents-office/reports--initiatives/envisioning-2030/
and https://www.capilanou.ca/about-capu/governance/presidents-office/reports--initiatives/illuminating-2030/
Take a virtual tour of our campus here: https://capilanou.ca/programs--courses/get-started/visit-capu/There is a Children's Centre on site that offers waitlist priority to
Capilano students and employees. https://www.capilanou.ca/student-services/health-services/child-care/
Remuneration and BenefitsAt Capilano University, we understand that
there is more to life than work. That is why we offer comprehensive benefits
and support to help you and your family live a balanced life. This position is classed as pay group 24.
The pay scale current to June 2022 is found on page 154 of the
MoveUp/Capilano University Collective Agreement, and ranges from $4,998.00 per month at Step One
(estimated $32.88 hourly), to $5,625.00 monthly at Step Five (estimated at
$37.01 hourly). Capilano University provides access to sick, family, and bereavement leave,
as well as a comprehensive health and dental benefits package. More details are available in Section 28 of the MoveUp/Capilano University Collective
Agreement. Working ConditionsWork week: 35 hours per week. CapU offers
an opportunity to request a compressed work schedule for modified work weeks. Capilano University is an equal
opportunity employer and Union membership in the Union (MoveUP) shall be a
condition of employment.ContactIf we could make the application process more accessible for you, or if you
have any questions, please contact Christina Neigel, University Librarian, at ChristinaNeigel@capilanou.caQuick Link for Postinghttps://jobs-capilanou.peopleadmin.com/postings/6130Applicant DocumentsRequired DocumentsResumeCover LetterOptional DocumentsTranscriptsLetter of RecommendationProof of Education Compensation $5,550.00 (with increments to a max of $6,243 per month) Closes: 13 October, 2023 Capilano University North Vancouver , BC Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Librarian 1 - Auxiliary (On-Call) Port Moody , BC Description Position Summary:
The Port Moody Public Library is seeking a creative and energetic auxiliary librarian with a passion for customer service. Reporting to the Digital & Information Services Coordinator, the position provides reader’s advisory, reference and tech help services for all ages.
Responsibilities:
Duties and responsibilities may include: working at the library’s information (reference) desk; providing one on one instruction; assisting with programs; collection merchandizing, maintenance and development; and special project work. Applicants with interest or expertise in providing youth services may also undertake children’s programs such as storytime and class visits.
Requirements:
Auxiliary librarians work on an on-call and as-needed basis. The position may be offered shifts from Monday to Sunday including evenings and holidays. Applicants who only have limited availability may not be considered.
Qualifications: Master’s degree in Library & Information Science (MLIS/MLS) from an ALA accredited program. Experience working in a public library setting providing reference and reader’s advisory services. Knowledge of public library collections in all formats. Familiarity with collection development principles. Knowledge of library information technology as it applies to public libraries in general. Ability to instruct/assist the public with using a variety of computer applications and devices (e.g. computers, laptops, tablets), and with accessing library resources such as eBooks. Ability to plan and present library programs for various age groups. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Excellent customer service skills including the ability to deal with challenging patrons. Ability to manage projects and to handle multiple and competing priorities. Demonstrated ability to work as a team member and to work collaboratively with others to improve services in a dynamic, collegial team environment. Ability to provide training in one-on-one and group settings.
Salary:
The salary is $36.94 to $39.74 per hour (2021 rate).
Please note that employment with the Port Moody Public Library is subject to the completion of a satisfactory criminal record search. Interested candidates are asked to submit a cover letter and resume online for Job ID J0923-0863 at www.portmoody.ca/jobs by October 2, 2023. Compensation $36.94 to $39.74 per hour (2021 rate) Closes: 2 October, 2023 Port Moody Public Library Port Moody , BC Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Executive Director and Chief Librarian Truro , NS Description COLCHESTER-EAST HANTS PUBLIC LIBRARY
Executive Director and Chief Librarian Job Posting
Closing Date: at 5p.m (ADT) October 14, 2023
The Colchester-East Hants Public Library (CEHPL) is seeking an Executive Director and Chief Librarian to provide leadership and vision for a progressive regional public library system dedicated to building strong and inclusive communities, collections, and connections, located in central Nova Scotia.
The successful candidate will provide professional expertise and strategic leadership for a dynamic, cross-functional team of 56 (32 FTEs), serving a population of over 74,500 in the municipalities of Colchester, East Hants, Truro and Stewiacke, through five branches, a regional headquarters, and a variety of outreach services. The main branch and regional headquarters are located in downtown Truro, in a newly renovated and expanded heritage building in the heart of the town’s civic square. Truro’s central location gives access to a town or rural lifestyle. Halifax, Atlantic Canada’s largest city, is only an hour’s drive away.
Working closely with the five-member Regional Management Team and reporting to the CEHPL Board, the Executive Director and Chief Librarian ensures cost-effective and quality public library service throughout the Colchester-East Hants region through strategic planning; policy development; management of CEHPL financial and human resources, including an annual operating budget of approx. $2.5 million; development and maintenance of library programs, collections, and technology; nurturing community libraries and outreach services; working with communities through partnerships, advocacy, and public relations; and serving as Secretary to the Board, a 10-member governing body comprising representatives from the library’s provincial and municipal funding partners.
The CEHPL Board is seeking an Executive Director and Chief Librarian who possesses the following knowledge, skills, abilities, and values: Proven leadership skills in a complex work environment Ability to effectively lead and manage change Action and results-oriented with the ability to recognize opportunities to improve service delivery Commitment to community-led library service, with an emphasis on equity, diversity, inclusion, and accessibility Proven track record for effectively managing resources, including financial and human resources Ability to build constructive and effective relationships with multi-level internal and external stakeholders Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills Ability to set priorities and inspire confidence Ability to perform work with efficiency and accuracy while adhering to deadlines Tact, courtesy and sound judgement in dealing with the public and staff Current knowledge of public library and office technology Awareness of trends in library programming, services, and policies
Valid driver’s license and ability to manage own travel throughout the region
The successful candidate will require a Master’s degree in librarianship from an ALA-accredited program. The candidate will have at least seven years of successful professional experience in a library system, including a minimum of five years of proven managerial experience. Business or management-related degrees or courses and capital construction project experience would be considered an asset.
An employment offer for this position will be conditional on the satisfactory results of a Criminal Record Check, Vulnerable Sector’s Check, and Child Abuse Registry Check.
This is a permanent position that is available commencing November 14, 2023. The salary and benefits are in accordance with CEHPL’s personnel policies, at a salary range of $76,094 - $92,529.
A visit to the library’s website at www.lovemylibrary.ca will provide additional information, including selected polices at https://www.lovemylibrary.ca/policies/ and annual reports at https://www.lovemylibrary.ca/annual-reports/.
Application Process
If you would like the opportunity to work with the CEHPL and continue the development of innovative and community-based library services, please forward your application in the form of a resume and cover letter, either by mail or email to:
Norval Mitchell, ChairColchester-East Hants Public Library
754 Prince Street
Truro, Nova ScotiaB2N 1G9
Email: ceojob@cehpubliclibrary.ca
Application Deadline: at 5p.m (ADT) October 14, 2023
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. CEHPL values diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including Indigenous Persons, African Nova Scotians and Other Racially Visible Persons, Persons with Disabilities, Women (applying for non-traditional positions), and Persons of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community. We encourage applicants from these designated groups to self-identify in the application process. Compensation Salary range of $76,094 - $92,529 Closes: 14 October, 2023 Colchester East-Hants Public Library Truro , NS Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Library Technician - Auxiliary (On-Call) Port Moody , BC Description Position Summary:
The Port Moody Public Library is seeking a creative and energetic Information Desk Library Technician with a passion for customer service. Reporting to the Digital & Information Services Coordinator, the position provides reader’s advisory, reference and tech help services for all ages.
The City of Port Moody is a growing community of 34,000 residents located 30 minutes east of downtown Vancouver at the head of the Burrard Inlet and just steps from seaside parks, mountain trails and lakes.
Responsibilities:
This position is primarily dedicated to providing information desk support providing reference and reader’s advisory services. The position works as part of a team that assists the public in using public Internet computers and the library’s on-line catalogue and the library’s print and online resources. The position will assist with special project work as needed. The position may also assist with collection maintenance and development and with cataloguing and acquisitions tasks. Applicants with interest or expertise in providing youth services may also undertake children’s programs such as Storytime and class visits.
Requirements:
Auxiliary Library Technicians work on an on-call and as-needed basis. The position may be offered shifts from Monday to Sunday including evenings and holidays. Applicants who only have limited availability may not be considered.
Qualifications: A diploma in Library and Information Technology plus a minimum of six months job related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Knowledge of adult and children’s literature and reference resources. Ability to instruct/assist the public with using a variety of computer applications and devices (e.g. computers, laptops, tablets), and with accessing library resources such as eBooks. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Excellent customer service skills including the ability to deal with challenging patrons. Computer skills and knowledge of automated library systems. Cataloguing expertise with a variety of materials. Ability to provide training in one-on-one and group settings. Ability to handle multiple and competing priorities. Demonstrated ability to work as a team member and to work collaboratively with others to improve services in a dynamic, collegial team environment.
Salary:
The salary is $31.90 to $34.32 per hour (2021 rate)
Please note that employment with the Port Moody Public Library is subject to the completion of a satisfactory criminal records search. Interested candidates are asked to submit a cover letter and resume online for Job Number J0923-0864 at www.portmoody.ca/jobs by October 2, 2023. Compensation $31.90 - $34.32 (2021 rate – Level 6) Closes: 2 October, 2023 Port Moody Public Library Port Moody , BC Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

position: Children's Services Assistant, Gear and Gadgets (Temporary)
jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Children's Services Assistant, Gear and Gadgets (Temporary) Paris , ON Description Title: Children’s Services Assistant, Gear and GadgetsLocation: Paris Branch, 12 William St Paris ON N3L 1K7Reports to: Director, Programs and CollectionsStatus: Temporary fulltime, approximately 12 monthsStart Date: Immediate
General Purpose
Reporting to the Director, Programs and Collections, the Children’s Services Assistant, Gear and Gadgets will assist readers of all ages in the selection and interpretation of library materials, perform circulation duties, and maintain an organized and attractive branch. They will perform professional duties that require adherence to standards of accuracy, timeliness, tact, and confidentiality. The position will manage the Gear and Gadgets collection, including making recommendations for purchase, maintaining the exiting collection, and organizing its physical storage. Preparation and presentation of programs and attending outreach events for all age groups related to the Gear and Gadgets collection will be additional duties. A varying schedule including evenings and weekends which may include travel will be a part of this role.
Knowledge
Candidates will possess proven excellent interpersonal skills in dealing with staff team members, excellent customer service skills and knowledge of the principles and practices of professional library work. An understanding of child and youth development, in-depth knowledge of children’s literature and reference techniques is required. Excellent technology skills, a strong knowledge of emerging Gear and Gadgets trends, proficiency with Microsoft Office applications and experience with integrated library systems is required. Candidates should have a proven ability to prepare and present programs to multiple age groups.
Education
A post-secondary degree or diploma in a related field is required. A recognized library science or information studies degree or diploma is preferred.
Experience
2 or more years of experience in a public library setting and a minimum 1 year of experience delivering public library programming.
Hours of work: 35 hours/week Initial Schedule: Week 1: Mon 9-5, Tues 12-8, Wed 9-5, Thu 12-8, Fri 9-5Week 2: Mon 9-5, Tues 12-8, Wed 9-5, Thu 12-8, Sat 9-5 Compensation: $50,669 to $59,259 (under review)
How to Apply
Applications may be submitted, in confidence, to the attention of Zeta Phillipo, Director, Programs and Collections, County of Brant Public Library by email: zeta.phillipo@brant.ca
Posting Closes: 9:00 a.m., Monday, September 25, 2023. The Library thanks all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Brant Public Library is committed to an inclusive workplace that reflects the community that we serve. The Library welcomes applications from all qualified individuals. A satisfactory Criminal Record Check is a condition of employment. The County of Brant Public Library is pleased to accommodate individual needs in accordance with the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). If contacted regarding this competition, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodation measures you may require during the selection process. Information received relating to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. location: The Canadian Journal of Library & Information Practice & Research
jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? Layout Editor The Canadian Journal of Library & Information Practice & Research Description Partnership: The Canadian Journal of Library & Information Practice & Research Partnership is accepting applications for 1 layout editor position. This is a volunteer position for a 2-year term (renewable).
Responsibilities
The Layout editor is a key member of the editorial team, working closely with section editors and the Editor-in-Chief.
Layout editors work on approximately five articles per issue for a total of ten articles per year. As a member of the editorial team, you will provide input into operational and strategic decisions about the journal. Benefits
This position is an excellent opportunity to expand your professional experience, establish your record in editing and web publishing, and collaborate with other LIS professionals.
The editorial team meets annually at the Ontario Library Association Super Conference. Attendance is optional and registration for all editorial team members is generously covered by the Ontario Library Association.
Qualifications Excellent English writing skills Thorough understanding of English grammar, punctuation and APA 7th edition Excellent attention to detail and time management skills Ability to communicate in writing in a tactful manner Ability to work in a highly collaborative virtual environment Familiarity with OJS workflow is an asset Bilingual layout editing skills are an asset About the Journal
Partnership is the journal of Canada's national network of provincial and territorial library associations. The journal promotes the exchange of ideas about libraries, librarianship, and information science among practitioners across all library sectors. This is a Canadian, open access journal publishing double-anonymous peer-reviewed research and editorially-reviewed articles.
Application and Selection Procedure
Deadline for applications is October 30, 2023.Letters of application stating interest and qualifications, along with a current CV, should be sent to:
Evette Berry, Editor-in-ChiefPartnership: the Canadian Journal of Library and Information Practice and ResearchEmail: partnershipjournal@gmail.com
Applications will be reviewed by a committee consisting of the Editor-in-Chief and members of the editorial team. As part of the selection process, candidates will complete a short layout editing exercise.
Réviseure ou réviseur
Partnership : Revue canadienne de la pratique et de la recherche en bibliothéconomie et sciences de l’information Partnership accepte des candidatures pour 2 postes de réviseure ou de réviseur. Il s'agit d'un poste bénévole pour un mandat de 2 ans (renouvelable).
Responsabilités
La réviseure ou le réviseur de textes est un membre clé du comité de rédaction qui travaille de près avec les rédactrices de sections et la rédactrice en chef.
Cette personne révise les manuscrits soumis afin d’améliorer la clarté de l'écriture : suppression des redondances; vérification de la grammaire, de l'orthographe et de la ponctuation; conformité avec le style bibliographique de la revue (7e édition du style APA).
Cette personne révise environ cinq articles par numéro pour un total de dix articles par année. En tant que membre du comité de rédaction, vous participerez aux décisions opérationnelles et stratégiques de la revue.
Avantages
Ce poste est une excellente occasion d’accroître votre expérience professionnelle et d’établir votre dossier en édition et en publication Web dans un environnement collaboratif.
Le comité de rédaction se rencontre annuellement à la Super Conference de l’Ontario Library Association. La participation est facultative, mais l’inscription au congrès pour tous les membres du comité de rédaction est gratuite, gracieuseté de l’Ontario Library Association.
Exigences Excellente maîtrise de l’anglais écrit Compréhension approfondie de la grammaire et de la ponctuation anglaises et des normes bibliographiques de la 7e édition du style APA Excellent souci du détail et excellente gestion du temps Aptitude à communiquer par écrit avec tact Capacité de travailler dans un environnement virtuel hautement collaboratif Connaissance avec le flux de travail dans OJS est un atout Compétences en révision de textes bilingues sont un atout
Au sujet de la revue
Partnership est la revue du réseau national canadien des associations des bibliothèques provinciales et territoriales. La revue favorise le partage d’idées concernant les bibliothèques, la bibliothéconomie et les sciences de l’information parmi les praticiens dans l’ensemble des secteurs des bibliothèques. C’est une revue en libre accès canadienne qui publie de la recherche évaluée par les pairs à double insu ainsi que des articles révisés par le comité de rédaction.
Processus de demande et de sélection La date limite pour présenter une demande est le 15 octobre 2023.Une lettre de demande indiquant votre intérêt et vos qualifications, accompagnée d'un CV à jour, doivent être envoyés à l'adresse suivante:
Evette Berry, rédactrice en chefPartnership: Revue canadienne de la pratique et de la recherche en bibliothéconomie et sciences de l’informationCourriel : partnershipjournal@gmail.com
Les demandes seront examinées par un comité composé de la rédactrice en chef et de membres du comité de rédaction. Dans le cadre du processus de sélection, les candidates et les candidats auront à effectuer une courte révision de texte. Compensation This is a volunteer position Closes: 30 October, 2023 Partnership The Canadian Journal of Library & Information Practice & Research Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

Senior Manager, Neighbourhood Services Saskatoon , SK Description Position Overview The Senior Manager, Neighbourhood Services is an integral member of the management team who is directly responsible for the overall leadership and management of the Neighbourhood Libraries. This position works closely with the Managers, Branches to coach, mentor, and support professional learning across Neighbourhood Services. The Senior Manager, Neighbourhood Services ensures strategic alignment in the hiring, training and evaluation of employees, the design and delivery of services provided at each library and in the community, the appearance and impression of the physical space, and all aspects of patron-employee experiences within each Branch. The Senior Manager, Neighbourhood Services is responsible for deescalating sensitive patron matters and, when required, employing creative solutions. This position is responsible for measuring the impact of services, suggesting improvements and implementing approved changes. The position ensures programs, services, policies, and practices are meeting the unique needs of each branch while maintaining alignment Saskatoon Public Library (SPL) as a whole. As a member of the management team, the Senior Manager, Neighbourhood Services provides system-wide leadership, leading system teams and acting as a change agent who fosters innovation, bringing forward, implementing, and assessing new ideas and processes and supports employee success. The Senior Manager, Neighbourhood Services provides accurate and efficient communication to implement strategic priorities and does so in a consistent and coordinated manner. This role works collaboratively with the Executive Team, Management Team, employees, stakeholders, and the public in the pursuit of success. This position works to support the needs of our community in alignment with SPL’s Community-inspired service model and Strategic Plan. The Senior Manager, Neighbourhood Services acts as an advisor to the Director, Public Services, and may be required to assume temporary operational responsibility for Public Services areas in the absence of the Director, Public Services.Key DutiesLeadership & Team Building Onboards, trains, coaches and supports managers in the Neighbourhood Libraries.Leads by example and demonstrates SPL values in all behaviours and interactions.Encourages and builds support for SPL’s vision, mission, and strategic goals by communicating expectations and rationale, and monitoring outcomes. Identifies opportunities to highlight the connection between strategy and daily activities.Creates a team environment that fosters effective working relationships, creativity, and innovation.Proactively addresses engagement, cooperation, and productivity.Acts as a change agent to positively inspire others and to champion change.Supports the development of a culture focused on community-inspired customer service, accountability, change, continuous improvement, and learning.Builds and supports a motivated and cohesive team.Celebrates achievements as made by individuals and teams.Supports employee performance and skills development through performance evaluations, development plans, learning opportunities, and ongoing feedback.Resolves employee matters, in collaboration with Human Resources and colleagues (if applicable), based on a sound understanding of the Collective Agreement and best practices.Collaborates with Marketing & Communications to promote SPL.Manage all aspects of employee development including recruitment, skills development, performance management, resolution of labour relations issues, and corrective action up to and including formal discipline and termination, supported by Human Resources.Strategic & Operations ManagementReceives confidential information and prepares confidential correspondence.Participates on committees and cross-functional teams, acting as the lead as
required.In collaboration with
the Director, Public Services establishes goals and objectives for the Central Library, monitors progress, evaluates outcomes, and provides recommendations for
improvement.Evaluates operations,
performance, and achievements in each area of responsibility and makes recommendations to Senior Managers and the Executive Team regarding effectiveness and requirements. Implements corrective plans as required.Implements SPL policies and procedures and recommends new policies and policy changes to the Executive Team.Oversees
workflow analysis and workflow redesign within the work unit, seeking clarification and advice when necessary, and mitigateIdentifies and implements annual project priorities and budgets, within the scope of responsibility, in cooperation with the Director, Public
Services.Service ExcellenceProvides innovative ideas to make service improvements.Facilitates public, stakeholder, and employee engagement relative to making
service improvements.Collaborates with the Director, Public Services, to determine service standards and operational benchmarks.Directs and coaches employees on service standards.Monitors target achievements for the Neighbourhood Libraries and develops action plans to address variances.Manages and participates in the public feedback process, ensuring the timely follow-up and
resolution of complaints.Financial Management Develops and submits operating and capital budget recommendations and options for the Neighbourhood Libraries on an annual basis.Manages budgets, ensuring control of expenses, and developing and implementing action plans to address variances.Actively participates on management teams in support of operational and strategic goals.Demonstrates understanding of working with people who face marginalization.Relationships with Internal & External Partners Serves as a management representative on joint labour/management committees.Develops and maintains relationships with external partners in consultation with the Director, Public Services to share best practices, and to represent SPL’s interests.Enables SPL to be an early adopter of new ideas, programs and services by keeping current in the library field through continuing education, attendance at conferences and workshops, and participation in professional associations and networking events. QualificationsMaster of Library Science or Masters of Library and Information Science Degree from an ALA-accredited program.Minimum of five years progressive professional experience in public library services, including a minimum of two years leadership and management experience.Demonstrated expertise in the stated accountabilities and competencies.Ability to travel independently to and between SPL activities and locations as needed.A current, acceptable Criminal Record Check is required.To Apply, please visit our website at https://saskatoonlibrary.ca/about/careers/ Compensation $106,157.28 - $124,737.84 annual Closes: 11 December, 2023 Saskatoon Public Library Saskatoon , SK Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

organization: Council of Prairie and Pacific University Libraries
jobDescription:
Toggle navigation En français Browse Job Listings FAQ Contact Register Log in Log in Forgot password? COPPUL Indigenous Knowledge Coordinator n/a , BC Description The Council of Prairie and Pacific University Libraries (COPPUL) is seeking an Indigenous Knowledge Coordinator. This is a three year part-time position with the possibility of renewal after three years. The position may be filled as a secondment. Benefits and 9% of salary in lieu of pension are included. Applications from Indigenous candidates will be preferred. Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority. A master's-level degree in library and information science, archives, or museum studies is preferred but other combinations of education and experience may be considered.
Reporting to the Executive Director and working closely with the Indigenous Knowledge Standing Committee, the Coordinator will work to advance COPPUL's Strategic Directions in the area of Indigenous Knowledge, and coordinate the work of the program. This includes establishing relationships with collaborators in COPPUL libraries and beyond, as well as working with COPPUL staff to establish tasks and timelines, and contributing to on-going program development. The Coordinator will work closely with the Executive Director and the Indigenous Knowledge Standing Committee Chair and Vice-Chair to establish goals and initiatives in this area.
A full job description is available here.
Requirements COPPUL is seeking a candidate who has experience working within Indigenous organizations or with Indigenous knowledge traditions and is able to demonstrate competency in this work. The candidate should have a holistic approach to project work and be able to plan and carry out tasks and assign responsibilities in collaboration with colleagues, as well as to ensure the project is progressing. We are ideally seeking someone with experience working in cross-organizational and distributed teams, and who has experience in academic libraries or archives, a community or academic research role, or a cultural heritage sector role. Candidates should demonstrate the ability to work with a wide range of people, and should have excellent oral and written communication skills.
Projects include event planning, working with vendors to extend access to library resources to northern Indigenous communities, working with other COPPUL colleagues on the Indigenous Historical Publications Working Group, among others (see the COPPUL website for details).
Preferred
Experience with program planning Experience in organizational and strategic planning Experience working with Indigenous languages Familiarity with digitization projects and/or digital preservationFamiliarity with licensing electronic resources and/or working with vendors
Salary and benefits
The starting salary range is $58,300 - $62,600/annum plus benefits and 9% of salary in lieu of pension. Hours will be negotiated with the successful candidate and will be dependent on experience and/or availability.
Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Accessibility
COPPUL is committed to equity and diversity and seeks to foster the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, ability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as an Indigenous person.Please apply by sending a CV and letter of interest to the COPPUL Executive Director at execdir@coppul.ca. Review of applications will begin on October 15, 2023, and continue until the position is filled. Candidates invited for interviews will be required to provide 3 references. Compensation $58,300 - $62,600 Closes: 27 November, 2023 Council of Prairie and Pacific University Libraries n/a , BC Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

Library Support Specialist St. Paul , AB Description Location: St. Paul campusPosition type: Full-time continuous termSalary: $3,687 to $4,781 per monthJob number: 23-LSB3-38-PJBClosing date: Until a suitable candidate is foundABOUT THE POSITIONPortage College has an exciting opportunity for an experienced
Library Support Specialist to work with the College’s Library
Service’s team. The incumbent in this position is responsible for
the operation of the St. Paul library, including: Circulation of materials using the automated library
system; manages and maintains ST. Paul collections;
fulfills branch interlibrary loans. Answer basic reference questions (in-person, phone or
virtual) and assist students with Microsoft Office,
electronic resource and internet searching, printing
and photocopying. Operation of the Library System and is the system
administrator and main contact for troubleshooting
issues. Updating the library website and other online content. Circulate Bookstore rental items.QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCEA diploma in Library and Information Technology;
Equivalencies in a relevant field of study, an
undergraduate degree and/or library experience may
be considered. A minimum of one-year public service experience in an
automated library environment and/or academic
institution is preferred. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and
ability to be an effective team member. Strong skills in organization, customer service, data
entry, chat and telephone etiquette. Must be self-directed and able to prioritize workload
with little or no supervision. Demonstrated teamwork and interpersonal skills. Proficient with computers, especially MS Office. Successful applicant will be required to provide a
current police information check.ABOUT THE COLLEGEPortage College has been serving the region for 50 years and is a first choice post-secondary institution for learners in northeast
Alberta. You will find that we are a college that combines quality with innovation. In fact, Portage College is considered a leader
when it comes to providing students with a flexible first-class educational experience. We offer a wide range of programs in health
and wellness, business, human services, university transfer, food sciences, trades and technology, native arts and culture, and in
academics for career and education. As an employee at the College, you will benefit from generous paid time off, participation in the College pension plan, excellent
health and dental benefits, and access to a strong professional development fund that allows employees to grow and develop
professionally by taking college or university courses, or attending conferences or workshops.HOW TO APPLYPortage College is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. If you have the right qualifications, experience and motivation to do extraordinary things at Portage College, we would love to hear
from you. Email your cover letter and resume to hr@portagecollege.ca. If you have any questions, call us at 780-623-5747.
Please note we do not accept third-party resume and cover letter submissions. The College appreciates the interest of all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Compensation $3,687 to $4,781 per month Closes: 10 October, 2023 Portage College St. Paul , AB Policies and Terms of Use · jobboard@bcla.bc.ca / BCLA PO BOX 19008, Rocky Point PO, Port Moody, BC V3H 0J1 window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
